item.title: Price of a Power Call Option
item.description: Price of European option with payoff $V(T)=\max (S^2(T) - K,0)$ Deriving the dynamics of $X(t) = S^2(t)$. In the Black-Scholes world, the stock price $S(t)$ has $\mathbb{Q}$-dynamics: $$ dS_t = rS(t)dt + \sigma S(t) dW^{\mathbb{Q}}(t) \tag{1} $$ Let $X(t) = S^2(t)$. The square of the stock price has the $\mathbb{Q}$-dyamics: $$ \begin{align*} dX_t &= 2S(t)dS(t) + \frac{1}{2}\cdot 2 \cdot dS_t \cdot dS_t\\ &= 2S(t) ( rS(t)dt + \sigma S(t) dW^{\mathbb{Q}}(t)) + \sigma^2 S^2(t) dt \\ &= S^2(t)[(2r + \sigma^2)dt + 2\sigma dW^{\mathbb{Q}}(t)]\\ &= X(t)[(2r + \sigma^2)dt + 2\sigma dW^{\mathbb{Q}}(t)] \end{align*} $$
